isis.stitle: TSI 92-14-01 - Checking Power Divider Input Shaft End Play, Forward Rear Axle

subjectgroup.subject: Checking Power Divider Input Shaft End Play, Forward Rear Axle

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to Models with Codes 14GDA and 14GDC Tandem Single Reduction Rear Axles.

Spicer Heavy Axle and Brake Division of Dana Corporation is recommending that checking the end play of the power divider input shaft be made part of the standard maintenance procedures for Codes 14GDA and 14GDC rear axles. Whenever the vehicle is serviced, the axle input shaft should be visually checked for excessive end play. A leaking input shaft may be the first indication of excessive end play. Input shaft end play should be measured every 100,000 miles.

Power dividers are assembled with 1 to 5 thousandths (.001 to .005) inch of end play when new. If the input shaft end play measures 25 thousandths (.025) inch at 100,000 miles, it will be necessary to reshim the unit. Refer to TSI-89-14-02, dated June, 1989 for the proper end play measuring and shimming procedures.

The 14GDA and 14GDC rear axle design used the side gears and pinion mates of the inter-axle differential to establish input shaft end play. As these components wear under normal usage, the end play will increase slightly. This increase in end play is not detrimental to vehicle operation, unless it is excessive.

If the end play exceeds 25 thousandths (.025) inch in less than 100,000 miles, it is possible the inter-axle differential components are wearing excessively, and inspection is recommended. If necessary to replace the inter-axle differential, use kit part number 1665307C91.

note.para: The inter-axle differential can be removed and replaced without removing the intermediate differential housing.

geninfo.para: The following procedures should be used to remove and install the inter-axle differential. For more detailed instructions for repairing the rear axle assembly, refer to GROUP 14-REAR AXLE in CTS-4001 or CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

step1.para: Disconnect the driveshaft at the forward axle input yoke.

note.para: It is not necessary to remove the input yoke or drain the gear lube at this time.

step1.para: Remove bolts attaching input bearing retainer.
Remove input shaft, yoke and front cover as a unit. Slots are provided for ease of removal.

note.para: If axle is equipped with a lube pump, it must be removed to access removal slots.

step1.para: Remove inter-axle differential shift cylinder, snap ring and spring.
Use a 10-inch pipe wrench to remove shift shaft from shift fork.
Carefully remove shift fork, clutch collar and helical drive gear.
Using a suitable pry bar, remove metal lube retainer plate (slinger) and discard.

Remove inter-axle differential assembly and inspect for excessive wear. If excessive wear is indicated, replace inter-axle differential. If no wear is indicated thoroughly clean and inspect for reassembly.
Remove any wear particles from inter-axle differential cavity in the power divider case. Clean RTV sealastic from mating surfaces.
Thoroughly clean all components for reassembly.

svcproc.title: Install
svcproc.para: Refer to GROUP 10-LUBRICATION in CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for lubrication information.

step1.para: Prelube and install inter-axle differential assembly.
Use the proper installation tool to install a new metal lube retainer plate.
Lubricate and install the helical drive gear.
Apply grease to the machined surface on the drive gear that contacts the large thrust washer. Install thrust washer with chamfer forward.
Slide shift fork into clutch collar groove with the raised section of fork forward.
Install fork and collar assembly into position with lugs engaged into the mating lugs on the drive gear.
Thread the shift shaft into the fork. Use a 10-inch pipe wrench to tighten the shaft to approximately 35 ft. lbs.
Install spring, snap ring and shift cylinder.
Apply a 1/8-inch bead of RTV gasket material to the input bearing retainer mating surface.

Install input shaft, bearing retainer and end yoke assembly into the power divider. Rotate the end yoke slowly while installing to help align input shaft splines with the mating splines in the inter-axle differential.
Bolt bearing retainer to the inter-axle differential housing. Evenly tighten the bolts to 70 ft. lbs. torque.
Check input shaft end play. Refer to TSI-89-14-02 for the proper procedure.
If the end play is within .001 to .005 inch, it will not be necessary to reshim the input shaft.
If the input shaft end play is over .005 inch, the input shaft must be shimmed. Refer to TSI-89-14-02 for the proper procedure.
Install driveshaft, air line to the air shift cylinder. Check and fill axle to proper lube level if necessary. Refer to GROUP 10-LUBRICATION.

note.para: If the end yoke is removed to install a new seal, re-install the end yoke washer and nut. Tighten the nut to 900 to 1200 ft. lbs.
